summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an attorney named Jack, forwarding a court order from Judge Alison Nathan. The order reminds all attorneys involved in the United States v. Maxwell case to comply with local court rules regarding the handling of sensitive materials, as the indictment has been expanded.

persons.name: Jack
persons.context: The recipient of the email from the Assistant U.S. Attorney, being informed about a court order applying to attorneys in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Issued the court order attached to the email, which applies to all attorneys in the United States v. Maxwell case.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, informing attorney Jack about Judge Nathan's order and offering to answer questions.

connections.description: The prosecutor is communicating a court order to the attorney, indicating a professional relationship within the legal proceedings of the Maxwell case.
Judge Nathan's order applies to attorney Jack, establishing a formal court-to-attorney authority relationship.

events.title: Email Forwarding Court Order
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails attorney Jack to inform him that a previous order from Judge Nathan now applies to all attorneys in the expanded Maxwell indictment, reminding them to comply with local court rules.

events.title: Judge Nathan Issues Order re Local Rule 23.1
events.description: Judge Alison Nathan issued an order regarding compliance with SDNY Local Rule 23.1, which governs the handling of sensitive materials in cases.

keyFacts: The indictment in United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) has been expanded, triggering the application of a prior court order to all involved attorneys.
Judge Alison Nathan had previously issued an order reminding counsel to comply with SDNY Local Rule 23.1, which pertains to the handling of case materials.
The communication is a procedural notice from a federal prosecutor to defense counsel, highlighting ongoing legal management in a high-profile case.
